thread.title: VIDEO/PHOTOS: Ketcham soccer tops John Jay in honor of McConologue
thread.title_full: VIDEO/PHOTOS: Ketcham soccer tops John Jay in honor of McConologue

title: VIDEO/PHOTOS: Ketcham soccer tops John Jay in honor of McConologue
text:
Activate your digital access. VIDEO/PHOTOS: Ketcham soccer tops John Jay in honor of McConologue Roy C. Ketcham boys soccer on its win over John Jay in honor of schoolmate battlling cancer. Stephen Haynes/Poughkeepsie Journal Stephen Haynes, Poughkeepsie Journal 6:35 p.m. EDT October 17, 2015 Roy C. Ketcham junior Kelly McConologue poses with custom jersey during boys soccer game. (Photo: Stephen Haynes/Poughkeepsie Journal) 113 CONNECT 22 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WAPPINGERS FALLS - It was quite the peculiar sight. No, not so much the Roy C. Ketcham High School boys soccer team dominating in a 3-0 upset of John Jay, but the Indians' attire. 
Ketcham, doing away with its usual blue and red, sported orange and black home jerseys on Saturday. And it had nothing to do with Halloween. 
The game was played in honor of Kelly McConologue, a Ketcham junior who is battling leukemia. She stood on the sideline, and even with a surgical mask on, cheered loudly for her schoolmates. Her bright eyes and wide smile belie the ordeal she has endured. 
"Stuff like this makes me feel a lot better," McConologue said. The 16-year-old was diagnosed with Acute Myelocytic Leukemia in April. "Being here reminds me that I have a lot of supportâ€¦ Positivity is what gets me through this." 
She was presented a custom Indians jersey during a pregame ceremony and the team's adopted slogan, "Play for Kelly," was yelled intermittently from the crowd. 
And the Indians did, indeed, play well for Kelly. Roy C. Ketcham junior Kelly McConologue poses with custom jersey during boys soccer game. Stephen Haynes/Poughkeepsie Journal The Roy C. Ketcham High School boys soccer team celebrates its 3-0 win over John Jay on Saturday in Wappingers Falls. Stephen Haynes/Poughkeepsie Journal Ketcham's Matt Lennox headers the ball to past John Jay's Kevin Turi during Saturday's game in Wappingers Falls. Patrick Oehler/Poughkeepsie Journal Ketcham's Eddie Armah gets the ball under control as John Jay's Michael Fino moves in on him during Saturday's game in Wappingers Falls. Patrick Oehler/Poughkeepsie Journal Ketcham's David Siriboe passes the ball past John Jay's Luke Melvin during Saturday's game in Wappingers Falls. Patrick Oehler/Poughkeepsie Journal Ketcham's Eddie May looks for a teammate to pass the ball to as John Jay's Mike Ciardullo covers him during Saturday's game in Wappingers Falls.
